snippet: There are still too many gaps and quirks in the health care reform law that could prevent the most vulnerable groups from getting insurance.
abstract: Editorial cites gaps in the healthcare system after passage of Affordable Care Act, many of which affect the most vulnerable groups in the nation; holds the 20 or more states that decided not expand Medicaid programs should do so, since federal government is offering generous matching funds; also calls for hospitals to move more aggressively to help people enroll in Medicaid or subsidized plans in the exchanges.
lead_paragraph: There are still too many gaps and quirks in the health care reform law that could prevent the most vulnerable groups from getting insurance.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
